result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from engaging in any further violent and/or confrontational contact with his father, G. Steffanides.

Defendant to complete an Anger Managment Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.  DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Huber Privileges granted.  Balance of sentence to be served forthwith.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.

Court costs reimposed as to Count Nos. 1 and 2 to the extent not previously paid.  Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment conditions as noted in Count 1.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilbert F. Steffanides

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:35 PM: Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections or material errors offered.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  Argument by DA.  Argument by SPD Szilagyi.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  As to Ct 1:  9 mos WCJ, 79 days TS credit.  As to Ct 2:  90 days WCJ concurrent to Ct 1 with 79 days TS credit also, Huber granted.  May transfer to another jurisdiction if arrangement can be made.  Court Costs reimposed - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

15CM220 & 15CM447 Cases called @ 2:31 p.m. Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM447: Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 1 & 2 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C/C w/ his father G. Steffanides, Anger Managment and  follow through, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. 2 days CFTS. Appeal rights given.

15CM220 - Parties have received and reviewed the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be made. The parties stipulate to 118 days CFTS. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Atty Zilles. No statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 1 - 7 mos WCJ - 118 days CFTS, Ct 3 - 7 mos WCJ concurrent - 87 days CFTS - Huber, GT. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 02-23-2016 03:15 pm

Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Paul Edward Zilles.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zilles-requests more time. Court grants.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
from Atty Zilles requesting adjournment due to family emergency

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant to provide updated address within 24 hours of release from custody.

Case Called @ 1:22 PM: Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi both appearing via video.  Defendant Gilbert F. Steffanides in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues for Signature Bond with conditions due to PO Hold.   SPD:  Joins in request for Signature Bond.  NGP received and entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 09:40 am.
